references.paper_title: A massive 7T fMRI dataset to bridge cognitive neuroscience and artificial intelligence
references.reason: This paper introduces a large-scale fMRI dataset crucial for training and evaluating the reconstruction methods discussed in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Cinematic Mindscapes: High-Quality Video Reconstruction from Brain Activity
references.reason: This paper demonstrates state-of-the-art video reconstruction from brain data, which directly relates to the focus of generative reconstruction methods in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Very deep VAE generalize autoregressive models and can outperform them on images
references.reason: This paper introduces a key model architecture used in many reconstruction methods described in the target paper, highlighting its importance for generative modelling.
This foundational paper introduces Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), a model architecture frequently used for image generation, which is relevant to the methods discussed in the target paper.

references.paper_title: Learning Transferable Visual Models From Natural Language Supervision
references.reason: This paper introduces CLIP, a model for multimodal understanding that is frequently used in the reconstruction methods, demonstrating its influence on the field.
